beers.name: Pliny the Elder
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-4499_ddce0_sm.jpeg
beers.description: Brewed with Amarillo, Centennial, CTZ, Cascade, Warrior, and Simcoe hops. Well-balanced with malt, hops, and alcohol. Slightly bitter with aromas of citrus, pine, and floral.

beers.name: Pliny the Younger
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-5187259_72193_sm.jpeg
beers.description: Pliny the Younger was Pliny the Elder's nephew, in the case of this beer, the Younger is a triple IPA. Pliny the Younger is medium bodied with tons of hop character in the aroma and mouthfeel. It is also deceptively well balanced and smooth.

beers.name: Helles
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-1685614_f399a_sm.jpeg
beers.description: Light lager and the purest expression of malt. Known to Bavarians simply as 'lager bier,' it is meant to toe the line between bland and sublime.

beers.name: Two Hearted IPA
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-4133_7382c_sm.jpeg
beers.description: Brewed with 100% Centennial hops from the Pacific Northwest and named after the Two Hearted River in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, this IPA is bursting with hop aromas ranging from pine to grapefruit from massive hop additions in both the kettle and the fermenter. Perfectly balanced with a malt backbone and combined with the signature fruity aromas of Bell's house yeast, this beer is remarkably drinkable and well suited for adventures everywhere.

beers.name: Fat Tire Ale
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-6887_8b748_sm.jpeg
beers.description: Made with premium ingredients, Fat Tire is a bright and balanced beer that's certified carbon neutral. Since 1991, we've been working to reduce our environmental impact, while investing a portion of every Fat Tire you buy in community-based climate action. From certified B-Corp New Belgium Brewing, this ale is easy-drinking and easy on the planet.

beers.name: La Terroir
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-30888_6062a_sm.jpeg
beers.description: Le Terroir is a french term meaning “of the earth”. Used to reference the environmental conditions that affect the brew, we like to think about the terroir of our foeders. These wooden barrels age our sour beer in varying temperatures, humidity, and vibrations. The terroir of New Belgium, so to speak. Add in another variable by dry-hopping with a rotating blend of fruit forward hops and we created a beer that changes every time we brew it.

beers.name: 90 Shilling
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-odell90-Shilling.jpg
beers.description: We introduced 90 Shilling, our flagship beer, at our opening party in 1989. For a while, we'd been wondering - what would happen if we lightened up the traditional Scottish ale? The result is an irresistibly smooth and delicious medium-bodied amber ale. The name 90 Shilling comes from the Scottish method of taxing beer. Only the highest quality beers were taxed 90 Shillings. A shilling was a British coin used from 1549 to 1982. We think you'll find this original ale brilliantly refreshing, and worth every shilling.

beers.name: Easy Street
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-odellEasyStreet.jpg
beers.description: Light and refreshing, Easy Street Wheat is an unfiltered American-style wheat beer. Leaving in the yeast gives the beer a nice, smooth finish and a slightly citrusy flavor.

beers.name: Palisade Peach Wheat
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-3936376_3a20a_sm.jpeg
beers.description: Hazy American wheat bursting with peach flavor

beers.name: Grapefruit Sculpin
beers.label: https://assets.untappd.com/site/beer_logos/beer-285658_c3745_sm.jpeg
beers.description: Our Grapefruit Sculpin is the latest take on our signature IPA. Some may say there are few ways to improve Sculpin’s unique flavor, but the tart freshness of grapefruit perfectly complements our IPA’s citrusy hop character. Grapefruit’s a winter fruit, but this easy-drinking ale tastes like summer.
